sbe.Pol_FFT_f2py module¶

sbe.Pol_FFT_f2py.polarization(fff, dim, params, bs, Ef_h, Ef_e, Tempr, V, damp, E_field, pulse_widths, pulse_delay, pulse_amp, e_phot, debug)[source]¶

Calculates the evolution of polarization and charge densities with time

Parameters:
  • [ParamName] ([ParamType](, optional)) – [ParamDescription], defaults to [DefaultParamVal]
  • fff (array) – frequency array,
  • bs (class) – Bandstructure details
  • Ef_h (constant) – Fermi level of holes
  • Ef_e (constant) – Fermi level of electrons
  • Tempr (constant) – Fermi level of electrons
  • V (array) – Potential
  • damp (constant) – damping coefficient
  • E_field (array) – Electric field as a function of time of the incident pulse
Returns:

Polarization and figure of the evolution quantities

sbe.constants module¶

sbe.int_matrix module¶

The non-diagnonal elements that appear in the Rabi frequency are

\[\begin{split}\begin{align} \label{eq:nondiagonal matrix elements Rabi} \sum_{\mathbf{q\ne k}}V_{\left| \mathbf{k-q} \right| }p_{q}(t)&= \cfrac{e^{2}}{8\pi^{2}\epsilon}\int_{0}^{\infty}f_qqp_{q}dq \int_{0}^{2\pi} \cfrac{d\theta}{\sqrt{k^{2}+q^2-2kq\cos\theta}}\\ &= \int_{0}^{\infty}V^{*}(k,q) p_{q} dq \end{align}\end{split}\]

The value of \(V^*(k,q)\) is the angle averaged Coulomb potential energy, defined by

\[\begin{align} \label{eq:Angle Averaged Coulomb Potential Energy} \color{red} { V^*(k,q) = \cfrac{e^{2}}{8\pi^{2}\epsilon}f_qq \int_{0}^{2\pi} \cfrac{d\theta}{\sqrt{k^{2}+q^2-2kq\cos\theta}}} \end{align}\]
